docs.abstract: The year has been bumpy for this Los Angeles museum, with Covid-19, questions about diversity and a leadership reorganization. But its director, Klaus Biesenbach, says, “every day is a chance to improve.”
docs.snippet: The year has been bumpy for this Los Angeles museum, with Covid-19, questions about diversity and a leadership reorganization. But its director, Klaus Biesenbach, says, “every day is a chance to improve.”
docs.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — Klaus Biesenbach strutted through the Geffen Contemporary, the Museum of Contemporary Art’s warehouse exhibition space recently, stylish in his signature midnight blue suit and black ankle boots. Talking about plans to reopen on June 3 and recent building improvements he has made as director, he came across like a guy with his hands on the steering wheel.

headline.main: Amid Signs of Trouble, Can MOCA Find Its Footing?
headline.print_headline: Los Angeles Museum  Tries to Find Its Footing

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Los Angeles Museum of Contemporary Art

docs.abstract: As live auctions resumed at Sotheby’s on Wednesday night, bidders there and at Christie’s the previous night welcomed a shift toward diversity in the contemporary art market.
docs.snippet: As live auctions resumed at Sotheby’s on Wednesday night, bidders there and at Christie’s the previous night welcomed a shift toward diversity in the contemporary art market.
docs.lead_paragraph: Just as the art market withstood the trauma of the Sept. 11 attacks and the economic plunge of 2008, so did the purchasing of high-priced paintings prevail at Sotheby’s on Wednesday during the first live contemporary auction since the onset of the pandemic in March 2020.

headline.main: Basquiat and Other Artists of Color Lead a Swell of Auction Sales
headline.print_headline: Basquiat and Other Artists of Color Lead a Swell of Auction Sales

docs.abstract: Zerina Akers wants widespread interest in Black brands to be more than a trend.

docs.lead_paragraph: The costume designer and wardrobe stylist Zerina Akers does not want people to think that her life is picture-perfect, even if she spends her time making sure that her clients are.

docs.abstract: Barring police and corrections officers from participating in Pride events shows a lack of farsightedness at a critical moment for L.G.B.T.Q. rights and support.
docs.snippet: Barring police and corrections officers from participating in Pride events shows a lack of farsightedness at a critical moment for L.G.B.T.Q. rights and support.
docs.lead_paragraph: Ana Arboleda always makes sure her police uniform is crisp and clean when she leaves home — but never more so than on New York’s annual Pride celebration, when two parts of her identity converge.

docs.abstract: Last year, more than 30 Times reporters across the country covered the demonstrations after George Floyd’s death. Here, 10 of them reflect on the sights and interactions that have stayed with them.
docs.snippet: Last year, more than 30 Times reporters across the country covered the demonstrations after George Floyd’s death. Here, 10 of them reflect on the sights and interactions that have stayed with them.
docs.lead_paragraph: Times Insider explains who we are and what we do, and delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how our journalism comes together.

headline.main: A Protest Moment I’ll Never Forget
headline.print_headline: Protest Moments They Will Never Forget

docs.abstract: A $4 billion federal fund meant to confront how racial injustice has shaped American farming has angered white farmers who say they are being unfairly excluded.
docs.snippet: A $4 billion federal fund meant to confront how racial injustice has shaped American farming has angered white farmers who say they are being unfairly excluded.
docs.lead_paragraph: LaGRANGE, Mo. — Shade Lewis had just come in from feeding his cows one sunny spring afternoon when he opened a letter that could change his life: The government was offering to pay off his $200,000 farm loan, part of a new debt relief program created by Democrats to help farmers who have endured generations of racial discrimination.

headline.main: ‘You Can Feel the Tension’: A Windfall for Minority Farmers Divides Rural America
headline.print_headline: Windfall for Black Farmers Roils Rural America
